platforms.name: Semantic Kernel
platforms.description: Semantic Kernel is an open-source Software Development Kit (SDK) from Microsoft that enables developers to seamlessly integrate Large Language Models (LLMs) from services like OpenAI, Azure OpenAI, Hugging Face, and others into conventional programming applications (C#, Python, Java). Its key capability is providing a flexible, plugin-based architecture to orchestrate AI services, manage prompts, access native skills, and handle memory, allowing developers to build sophisticated, AI-augmented agents and copilots. It uniquely bridges the gap between traditional application logic and generative AI by treating prompts and native code as composable 'skills' or 'plugins' within a cohesive 'kernel,' making it a powerful framework for agentic and multi-step AI workflows.
keyFeatures: Multi-language SDK support (C#, Python, Java) with consistent abstractions
Planner for dynamically creating and executing multi-step AI plans/pipelines
Plugin architecture for packaging native code functions and semantic prompts as reusable skills

platforms.name: Google Dialogflow
platforms.description: Google Dialogflow is a conversational AI platform for designing and integrating chatbots and voice assistants. It enables developers to build natural, multi-turn dialogues using pre-built agents, intent recognition, and entity extraction. Its key differentiator is deep integration with Google Cloud services, Google Assistant, and a wide range of messaging channels, making it a robust choice for scalable, enterprise-grade conversational interfaces.
keyFeatures: Intent recognition and classification for understanding user goals
System and developer-defined entity extraction for capturing key information
Multi-turn, context-aware conversation flows with fulfillment via webhooks

platforms.name: GPTBots.ai
platforms.description: GPTBots.ai is a no-code platform that enables businesses to build, train, and deploy custom AI chatbots and assistants. Its key capabilities include connecting to proprietary data via documents and APIs, supporting multiple LLMs (like GPT-4 and Claude), and offering deep integration with business systems such as CRM and Slack. It uniquely combines an intuitive visual workflow builder with enterprise-grade features like fine-tuning and comprehensive analytics, targeting users who need tailored AI solutions without deep technical expertise.
keyFeatures: Visual drag-and-drop workflow builder for bot logic
Knowledge base training from documents (PDF, Word, Excel, TXT) and website URLs
Multi-LLM support (OpenAI GPT series, Anthropic Claude, open-source models via API)

platforms.name: Dust.tt
platforms.description: Dust.tt is a collaborative AI platform that enables teams to design, deploy, and manage custom AI assistants and multi-step workflows by connecting large language models (LLMs), internal data sources, and external tools. Its core capability lies in a visual builder for creating complex, deterministic AI applications that can retrieve knowledge, execute code, and take actions via APIs. It uniquely targets technical and non-technical professionals seeking to build reliable, company-specific AI agents beyond simple chat interfaces.
keyFeatures: Visual workflow builder with drag-and-drop blocks for models, data, code, and tools
Native connections to major LLM providers (OpenAI, Anthropic, Cohere, Google) and open-source models
Enterprise-grade data connectors (Google Drive, Slack, GitHub, Notion, Intercom) with managed sync

platforms.name: Adept
platforms.description: Adept is an AI research lab and product company building generalist AI agents that can perform complex digital tasks by interacting with any software interface using natural language. Its flagship model, ACT-1, is trained to understand screen context, execute precise actions (clicks, keystrokes, navigation), and complete multi-step workflows across websites and desktop applications. It uniquely focuses on creating a 'co-pilot for everything' that acts directly on user interfaces, targeting enterprise automation by turning language instructions into reliable software operations.
keyFeatures: ACT-1 foundation model for UI interaction
Natural language to precise UI action translation
Cross-application workflow execution (web & desktop)

platforms.name: LuminaChat
platforms.description: Enterprise chat platform with integrated AI agents that can access company knowledge bases, perform actions, and collaborate. Features team workspace, audit trails, and custom agent creation. For customer support and internal operations teams.
keyFeatures: Multi-agent collaboration
Company knowledge base integration
Custom action execution

platforms.name: Nexus Orchestrator
platforms.description: Multi-agent workflow platform that coordinates specialized AI agents to complete complex business processes with human-in-the-loop oversight and audit trails.
keyFeatures: Drag-and-drop agent workflow builder
Real-time collaboration between agents
Comprehensive audit logging
